p: The salted and sun-dried meat samples were brought to room temperature prior to the Warner–Bratzler Shear Force (WBSF) analysis. At least three cores with a 1.27-cm diameter and 2.0-cm length that were parallel to the muscle fibers were removed from each sample using a cork borer. Each core was sheared perpendicular to the fiber direction. The shear force was measured with a texture analyzer (Texture Analyzer TX-TX2, Mecmesin, NV, USA) fitted with a Warner–Bratzler type shear blade with a load of five kg f and a cutting speed of 20 cm/min [ 25].
